Key Match Events: England won by 10 wickets with 62 balls remaining.
Aaron Jones' six over midwicket to seal a rousing opening-night win over Canada was a notable moment.
Liam Livingstone's innings of 33 off 17 balls in a losing cause against South Africa was highlighted.
Pre-Game Insights: USA looked to thwart England's charge towards the semi-finals.
USA wanted to take down another Full Member nation in what was likely to be their last game at the World Cup.
England and USA met at both football and rugby World Cups but this was their first cricketing encounter of the modern age.
Jos Buttler's side had endured a choppy campaign so far, winning three and losing two to go with a no result in their opening match at Kensington Oval.
Victory would put England on four points, and a margin of more than ten runs (batting first) would ensure their net run-rate goes above that of South Africa.
England's cushion came from their convincing win over the other co-hosts West Indies at the start of the Super Eight.

England had rarely been at their best over the last three weeks in the Caribbean but there were signs that their game was coming together at the right time for a tilt at becoming the first team to successfully defend the T20 World Cup trophy.
USA had burned brightly at the start of the tournament but had looked to be running low on gas after three defeats in a row against Full Member oppositions.
Aaron Jones, Monank Patel, and Saurabh Netravalkar were highlighted as key players for USA.
Liam Livingstone's attempt to get England over the line against South Africa was noted as a significant performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler readied his troops to go again, emphasizing the importance of winning the game.
Aaron Jones promised that USA would go hard against England and try to finish well, despite not being able to advance to the next round.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kensington Oval is one of only two venues at this World Cup to have seen a 200-plus score, but generally, the pitches have been on the tacky side.
The forecast for Sunday had improved although there was still a chance of rainfall interrupting proceedings.
This was the first meeting between England and USA with full international status in any format.
England had played 13 completed T20Is in Bridgetown, winning six (including the 2010 T20 World Cup final) and losing seven.
Sam Curran needed one more wicket to reach 50 in T20Is.
